61 [Alle halewene day]
Alle halewene-day we holdez : one time in þe &yogh;ere;
For manie enchesones holie churche : þare-to us gan lere.
On is, for þe grete noumbre : þat of alle halewe is,
Þat euerech ne mai nou&yogh;t at is feste : ane day habbe, i-wis.
An oþur is, þat we beoth feble : þat we ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht alle
Þe festene bi heom-sulf holde : ase huy in þe &yogh;ere doth falle.
Þe þridde ancheson[al. om.] is, for þe &yogh;er is schort : ase ech ne may nou&yogh;th allone
Þe[al. Ane] feste habbe in þe &yogh;ere : þare huy habbez i-mone.
Þe feorþe enchesun is, i-wis : for guod ri&yogh;ht it is with-alle
Þat we of heom maken feste : &yogh;wane þe time doth falle,
For gret feste huy makiez in heouene : and in grete Ioye beoth
&YOGH;wan huy any a-mendement : of us on vrþe i-seoth;
For þe guod-spel seith of swich gret Ioye : þat a-mong heom in heouene is
&YOGH;wane ani of us a-mendi wole : of þat we doth a-mis.[vv. 13-14 al. om.]
¶ þe fifte enchesun is, for þare was : a forbuysne þar-of bi-gonne
Longue are þe strencþe of cristinedom : on vrþe were i-wonne:
For þe hey&yogh;e maystres of saresins : þat on vrþe weren þo her[MS. here]
Maden ech maumat bi heom-sulf : at rome on Auter;
Ac natheles of eche ne mi&yogh;hte he nou&yogh;t : for here godes so fale were,
And huy nolden nou&yogh;th þat ani god were : with-oute honour þere:
Þare-fore huy maden on Auter : commuyn to ech-one,
For-to honouri alle heore godes þare : ase it were al i-mone.
And sethþe þo cristinedom cam : and swyþe wide spradde,
At rome and eke elles-&yogh;ware : clanliche þe maystrie hadde,
¶ Bonefas, þe guode pope : to þe false Auteres cam
And of þe Autere of alle godes : grete &yogh;eme he nam:
In forebuysne þar-of : ane churche he liet a-rere
Of ore lauedi and of alle haluwene : in þulke place þere—
Ake six hundret &yogh;er and fiue : ore louerd [þer-]bi-fore
of marie, is suete moder : on vrþe was i-bore.
¶ Þe churche þat of ore lauedi was : and of alle halewene þo bi-founde,
Stant &yogh;eot at rome, and is i-cleped : "Marie la rounde."
Þe pope al-so Bonefaz : ane day in þe &yogh;ere
In þe honour of alle halewene : he liet halewi þere,
And hiet al-so þoru&yogh;h al cristinedom : halewi þilke day;
Ake þulke tyme he was i-holde : þe endlefte dai of may.
Ake þe pope Gregori : þat þare-aftur longue cam,
I-say&yogh; þat þe day to halewi was : ope al cristindom
And þat ri&yogh;ht was þat ech man : þe hexte and leste,
In þe honour of alle haluwene : made þane day feste;
And in[al. om.] a skars tyme of þe &yogh;ere : ase we wyten, it was in May
So gret feste forto holde : ase ful to þad[r. þat] day:
Þare-fore he liet þane day tuyrne : ase we him holdez &yogh;uyte,
In þe furste dai of nouembre : &yogh;wane ech guod nis nouh&yogh;t so luyte;
¶ "Me þinchez, &yogh;uyt," quath þe guode man : "þe feste feble were
bote Men hadden &yogh;ware-with : þe wombe Ioye a-rere."—
¶ Þe furste &yogh;er þare-aftur-ward : þat men þane day þus nome,
Of a fair cas ich may telle : þat bi-feol in þe churche of rome.
Þe wardein of seint peteres church : þat &yogh;uyt in rome is,
Þe feste honourede swyþe muche : of alle halewene, i-wis:
on alle halewene-day in churche : to ech auter he gan gon
And honourede ech aftur oþur : he ne liet nou&yogh;ht on.
To þe hei&yogh;e auter of seint petre : ate laste he wende,
And þare he lay a-doun an slep : ase god him grace sende.
him þou&yogh;te, þare cam an Aungel : and ladde him to heouene on hei&yogh;h.
In a chayere with gret Ioye : ore louerd, him þou&yogh;hte, he sei&yogh;h
with grete hei&yogh;hnesse sitte : and Aungles him al-a-boute.
¶ Þo cam þare a fair leuedi : with Maydenes a gret route—
Þat was ore lauedi with virgines— : and ore louerd faire heo grette;
Ore louerd a-&yogh;ein hire a-ros : and bi him fayre hire sette.
Þo cam þare a Man in o sclaueyn : ase hit of a Camayle were,
And olde hore Men aftur him : and honoureden god þere—
Þat was seint Iohan þe baptist : and þe profetes olde
And also þe patriarkes : þat of ore louerd &yogh;wylene tolde.
¶ Þo comen þare twelue in one route : ase bischopes it weren ech-one,
Þe furste ase he pope were[MS. huy popes weren] : bi-fore he &yogh;eode al one—
Þat was seint petre : and his felawes endleuene;
Alle huy honourede ore louerd : þare he sat in heouene.
¶ Þo comen þare ase hit kny&yogh;htes weren : redie for-to fi&yogh;hte,
Al-blodie, for-to defendi ore louerd : and holie churche ri&yogh;hte—
Þat weren Marty[r]s þat for god : and holie churche al-so
&YOGH;euen heore lif ase godes kny&yogh;htes : and to deþe weren ido.
¶ Þo cam þare a gret compaygnie : preostes ase þei it were—
Þat weren þe confessours : þat hadden holie churche to lere,
Ase bischopes and Abbodes : and oþur guode men al-so.
Ore louerd huy honoureden alle : ase heore ri&yogh;hte was to do;
Of feste þat Men on vrþe maden : huy þonkeden him and bade
For alle þat a-ri&yogh;ht heore day heolden : and feste of heom made.
¶ Þo gonne[MS. goune] huy singue heore Matines : swyþ[e] murie with-alle,
For alle þat honouriez heore day here : ase heo in þe &yogh;ere doth falle.—
wel ou&yogh;hte we þane day honouren : &yogh;wane huy þat ilke day
Swuch Ioye for us in heouene maden : ase þe guode Man i-say.
Nou bidde alle halewene : þat we heore feste holden so
Þat huy us bringuen to þe hey&yogh;e Ioye : þare huy buth inne i-do.
